title: SHM - object on spring and pendulum

content.question: Two systems, a simple pendulum and a mass hanging on an ideal spring, both have a period of <math alttext="1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> when set into small oscillatory motion on Earth. They are then set into small oscillatory motion on Planet <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, which has the same diameter as Earth but twice the mass. Which of the following statements is true about the periods of the two objects on Planet <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> compared to their periods on Earth?

choices.label: Both periods of oscillation are shorter.
Both periods of oscillation are the same.
The period of the mass on the spring is shorter; the period of the pendulum is the same.
The period of the pendulum is shorter; the period of the mass on the spring is the same.

content.answer: The period of the pendulum is shorter; the period of the mass on the spring is the same.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
